user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_uio_dev_dma_unmap:
```c
static void metal_uio_dev_dma_unmap(struct linux_bus *lbus,
				    struct linux_device *ldev,
				    uint32_t dir,
				    struct metal_sg *sg,
				    int nents)
{
	(void) lbus;
	(void) ldev;
	(void) dir;
	(void) sg;
	(void) nents;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
static void metal_uio_dev_dma_unmap(struct linux_bus *lbus,
				struct linux_device *ldev,
				uint32_t dir,
				struct metal_sg *sg,
				int nents)
{
	(void) lbus;
	(void) ldev;
	(void) dir;
	(void) sg;
	(void) nents;
}
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the function contains only (void) casts of its parameters to avoid unused-parameter warnings. All statements in the function are reachable when the function is invoked; there is no code that can never be executed (no code after return, no conditional blocks that are always false, no infinite loops preventing later code, etc.).
